title: I have been seeing more reports about covid-19 being a permanent pandemic. How will we be able to handle this? Will people being glued to iPads and cellphones now be considered a good thing? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since humankind exists, there have always been diseases, pandemics, ravaging mankind. Back in the days, measles, tuberculosis, malaria, flu were pandemic, but overtime, due to medical science these become just sporadic illnesses. If history has taught us anything, pandemic comes and goes, till the next one hits. More important is, did we learn from each infection to prepare for the next one. On the question of addiction to one's connected devices, be these handphones, tablets or computers, is never a good thing. There is a larger life outside of these devices. Most of the younger generations are so absorbed in their devices that it compromises their own safety in public, such as in crossing the road safely, for example. These younger generations if they leave home without their phone, will return home to get them. But if they leave home without their pants, they don't bother !
